intro: Rhysolepis nudibasilaris, commonly known as the naked basal rhysolepis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features a slender, often hairless stem with small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers are small and white, clustered in umbrella-like structures, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
